meanings.definition: A small amount or portion of something, typically a soft or semi-liquid substance.
meanings.sent1: Mom added a dollop of cream to my hot cocoa.
meanings.sent2: The chef placed a dollop of whipped cream on the dessert.
meanings.sent3: The dollop of ketchup on his nose made him look silly.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like a dollop of joy in the room.
meanings.sent5: The dollop of honey on the toast glistened in the sunlight.

meanings.definition: To add a small amount of something in a casual or haphazard manner.
meanings.sent1: She dolloped some sauce onto the pasta dish.
meanings.sent2: He dollops sugar into his coffee without measuring.
meanings.sent3: The kids dolloped paint on the canvas, creating a messy masterpiece.
meanings.sent4: The singer dolloped emotion into every note of the song.
meanings.sent5: The chef dolloped the sauce onto the plate with a flourish.
